refnamediv.refpurpose: A suite of tools for communicating with Palm handhelds, such as those made by Palm, Handspring, Handera, TRGPro, Sony or other Palm Compatible Handheld PDA device.

refsect1.title: Section
refsect1.para: Pilot-link: Overview

refsect1.title: description
refsect1.para: The pilot-link suite of tools contains a series of conduits, libraries, and language bindings for moving information to and from your Palm device and your desktop or server/workstation system, as well as across the network.

refsect1.title: target device
refsect1.para: The /dev/pilot fallback has been removed in v0.12. The environment variable $PILOTPORT can be set in your shell, to save specifying the port each time. A serial device specified on the command-line will be used regardless of any $PILOTPORT setting. If $PILOTPORT is not set, and -p is not supplied, all conduits in pilot-link will print the usage information. The default connection rate is 9600 baud. You are welcome to try higher baud rates (19200, 38400, 57600 or higher) by setting the $PILOTRATE environment variable, but various machines have various limitations. (Be careful about values higher than 115200 on older Linux boxes if you've been using setserial to change the multiplier).

refsect1.title: Conduits
refsect1.para: A complete list of conduits available from within the pilot-link package as of the date of this manpage. If you invoke any of the conduits from pilot-link with no command-line arguments at all, the usage summary will be printed.
Note that there are widespread changes in this release - some conduits have been merged, a lot have had new options added and some options have been renamed or removed.

refsect2.title: addresses
refsect2.para: DEPRECATED: Use pilot-addresses --write|--human-readable instead.

refsect2.title: pilot-hinotes
refsect2.para: Syncronize your Hi-Notes database with your desktop machine.

refsect2.title: install-datebook
refsect2.para: installs a new datebook entry onto your Palm handheld.

refsect2.title: pilot-install-expenses
refsect2.para: Install an expense record from various parameters and arguments passed at connection time.

refsect2.title: install-hinote
refsect2.para: Install local files into your Hi-Note database on your Palm handheld.

refsect2.title: install-memo
refsect2.para: Installs a new Memo Pad entry onto your Palm handheld.

refsect2.title: install-netsync
refsect2.para: reads or sets the Network Preferences information on a Palm Device. Modifies the "Network Preference" settings and reports additional intormation about the Palm, such as the IP, hostname, and other information as they are set on the Palm.

refsect2.title: install-todo
refsect2.para: Updates the Palm ToDo list with one new entry.

refsect2.title: install-todos
refsect2.para: Updates the Palm ToDo list with entries from a local file.

refsect2.title: install-user
refsect2.para: Reads or sets a Palm User and UserID on a Palm Device. Modifies the "User Preference" settings and reports additional intormation about the Palm, such as the Username and UserID as they are set on the Palm

refsect2.title: pilot-memos
refsect2.para: Manipulate Memo entries from a file or your Palm device.

refsect2.title: pilot-addresses
refsect2.para: Read and write address book databases to and from a Palm handheld.
Changes in 0.12: Incorporates functionality from the now deprecated addresses conduit.

refsect2.title: pilot-archive
refsect2.para: DEPRECATED: Use read-todos -w --archived instead.

refsect2.title: pilot-clip
refsect2.para: Get or Set the Palm Clipboard contents from STDOUT/STDIN.

refsect2.title: pilot-dedupe
refsect2.para: Removes duplicate records from any Palm database.

refsect2.title: pilot-file
refsect2.para: Dump application and header information from your local PRC/PDB files.

refsect2.title: pilot-foto
refsect2.para: Palm 'Foto' Image Installer/Remover/Fetcher/Converter

refsect2.title: pilot-schlep
refsect2.para: Package up any arbitrary file and sync it to your Palm device.

refsect2.title: pilot-treofoto
refsect2.para: Copies Treo foto databases to current directory and extracts .jpg files from them.

refsect2.title: pilot-wav
refsect2.para: Decodes Palm Voice Memo files to wav files you can read

refsect2.title: pilot-xfer
refsect2.para: Backup, sync, and restore databases from a Palm handheld device.

refsect2.title: read-expenses
refsect2.para: Export Palm Expense application data in a text format.

refsect2.title: read-ical
refsect2.para: Exports the DatebookDB and/or ToDo applications (DatebookDB.pdb and ToDoDB.pdb respectively) to Ical format. (The ical application must be installed and working on your system first. This is NOT the same thing as the iCal Calendar format, however).

refsect2.title: read-notepad
refsect2.para: List the record information found in the Palm Notepad (Palm OS4 and later) application.

refsect2.title: read-palmpix
refsect2.para: Convert all pictures in the files given or found on a Palm handheld.

refsect2.title: read-screenshot
refsect2.para: Read screenshots from Palm (ScreenShotDB).

refsect2.title: read-todos
refsect2.para: Syncronize your Palm ToDo application's database with your desktop machine.

refsect2.title: read-veo
refsect2.para: Synchronize your Veo Traveler databases

refsect2.title: pilot-reminders
refsect2.para: Exports your Palm Datebook database into a 'remind' data file format.

refsect2.title: pilot-debugsh
refsect2.para: Simple debugging console for a Palm Handheld device (deprecated).

refsect2.title: pilot-dlpsh
refsect2.para: An interactive Desktop Link Protocol (DLP) Shell for your Palm device. This is very useful for debugging potential problems with your serial port. Query the RAM/ROM, list databases, change your UserID or Username, and many other useful functions. This is the "Swiss Army Knife" of any of pilot-link's tools.

refsect2.title: pilot-csd
refsect2.para: Connection Service Daemon for Palm Devices

refsect2.title: pilot-getram
refsect2.para: Retrieves the RAM image from your Palm device for use in debugging.

refsect2.title: pilot-getrom
refsect2.para: Retrieves the ROM image from your Palm device for use in debugging.

refsect2.title: pilot-getromtoken
refsect2.para: Reads a ROM token from a Palm Handheld device.

refsect2.title: pilot-nredir
refsect2.para: Accept connection and redirect via Network Hotsync Protocol.

refsect1.title: Perl Scripts
refsect1.para: (Available from the source code, not always installed from packages).

refsect2.title: ietf2datebook.PL
refsect2.para: Converts IETF agenda format to install-datebook format

refsect2.title: pilot-undelete.PL
refsect2.para: Turn previously archived records into normal (non-archived) records by resetting the "dirty" bit.

refsect2.title: sync-plan.PL
refsect2.para: completely synchronize the Palm datebook with the "plan" calendar via netplan, including authenticating to the netplan server itself.

refsect1.title: advanced programs
refsect1.para: Some of these programs are not intended for general end-users. More detailed documentation on their usage can be obtained by reading the source of the application itself.

refsect2.title: ccexample
refsect2.para: test program demonstrating C++ interface.

refsect2.title: iambicexample
refsect2.para: test program demonstrating C++ interface.

refsect2.title: validate
refsect2.para: experimental program to test C++ features.

refsect1.title: obtaining
refsect1.para: The most current version of the pilot-link suite of tools can be found at the pilot link homepage: http://www.pilot-link.org/

refsect1.title: mailing list
refsect1.para: The original pilot-unix mailing list has been taken offline, and is now being hosted and maintained by David A. Desrosiers desrod@gnu-designs.com. The original pilot-unix mailing list was maintained by Matthew Cravit. Its mandate was:

blockquote.para: The pilot-unix mailing list is for discussion and "idea-sharing" for those interested in using your Palm handheld with UNIX systems. This includes people who are interested in helping to develop tools to allow the Palm to operate with UNIX and other POSIX systems, and possibly to develop an SDK (Software Develop- ment Kit) for the Palm for Unix.

refsect1.para: For more information, including how to subscribe to the pilot-link mailing lists, please visit the pilot-link mailing list subscription page:
http://lists.pilot-link.org/
pilot-link specific mailing lists are also available for Development, General, and Announce topics, at the following:
http://lists.pilot-link.org/mailman/listinfo/pilot-link-devel
http://lists.pilot-link.org/mailman/listinfo/pilot-link-general
http://lists.pilot-link.org/mailman/listinfo/pilot-link-announce

refsect1.title: author
refsect1.para: Most of the pilot-link tools were written by Kenneth Albanowski. This manual page was written by David H. Silber pilot@orbits.com, and updated for version 0.12 of pilot-link by Neil Williams linux@codehelp.co.uk.
Current maintainer of pilot-link as of the authoring of this manpage is David A. Desrosiers desrod@gnu-designs.com.

Any questions or problems with pilot-link should be directed at the various pilot-link mailing lists or to the irc channel dedicated to supporting pilot-link at irc.pilot-link.org in your irc application (not a web browser).

refsect1.title: patches
refsect1.para: All patches you wish to submit should be sent to patches@pilot-link.org directly, with a brief explanation of what the patch adds or fixes. Please make sure to send your patched in unified diff format (diff -u).
